The quality of the starting RNA samples is critical for the success of the PEAT strategy.
Isolate total RNA from higher eukaryotes \(both animal and plant).
For yeast cells, hot-phenol approach1 tends to
To avoid potential biases that may incur during library construction, it is preferable to start with ~150 μg total RNA if the sample is easy to be obtained.
For low-abundance samples, it is possible to
In this protocol, we use Drosophila embryos to demonstrate the PEAT strategy.
One can adapt the protocol to construct PEAT libraries for other species as well
RNeasy Mini kit \(QIAGEN) is used to
Move genomic DNA contamination in RNA preparation.
On-column DNase I digestion step is included according to the manufacturer’s protocol Starting with ~150 μg total RNA, the final product is eluted with 80 μl nuclease-free water.
The integrity of the purified RNA is checked with1.2% formaldehyde agarose gel \(FA gel).
Alternatively, Agilent RNA Nano Labchip can be used to
Proceed to the next step if the RNA samples
Perform two rounds of polyA+ selection with Dynabeads \(dT)25 according to manufacturer’s protocol.
Use all of the purified total RNAs from the previous step and
Elute the polyA+ RNA with 30 μl elution buffer \(10mM Tris-HCl, pH7.5).
Lithium salt resulting from polyA+ selection step might affect downstream enzymatic activity.
RNeasy MinRlute kit is therefore used to
Move residual lithium by following the manufacturer’s protocol.
Elute the column twice, each with 40 μl nuclease-free water.
The resulting products are then quantified with a nano
From 150 μg total RNA, the typical yield of purified polyA+ RNA is 2-3 μg.

Preparing the following reaction in an RNase-free 1.7ml tube:
  RNA from step 5   80 μl
Incubate the reaction at 37 °C for 45 min. Add 100 μl nuclease-free water to the reaction.
Extract once with 200 μl phenol/chloroform and then with 200 μl chloroform.
Perform ethanol precipitation by adding 20 μl 3 M NaOAc \(pH 5.2), 2 μl GlycoBlue and 500 μl ethanol.
Pellet once with 70% ethanol, followed by adding 85.5 μl nuclease-free water to
Critical step: Completely removal of the phosphate group on the uncapped RNA molecules before TAP treatment is critical for reducing background noise.

Preparing the following reaction in a RNase-free 1.7 ml tube:
  BAP treated RNA from step 7   85.5 μl
Incubate the reaction at 37 °C for 1 h. Add 100 μl nuclease-free water to the reaction.
Extract once with 200 μl phenol/chloroform and then with 200 μl chloroform.
Perform ethanol precipitation by adding 20 μl 3 M NaOAc \(pH 5.2), 2 μl GlycoBlue and 500 μl ethanol.
Dissolve the BAP and TAP treated RNA in 13 μl nuclease-free water.

Combing the following in a 1.7ml RNase-free tube:
  BAT/TAP treated polyA+ RNA from step 9   13 μl
Critical step: The ratio of linker:RNA should be larger than 10:1 to
Sequence of Mme_CAP_RDhyb: 5’-CTC AAG CTT CTA ACG ATG TAC GCT CG rArGrUrCrCrArArC-3’, ‘r’ denotes ribonucleotide.
Mix the reaction well by pipetting and
Incubate at room temperature for at least 3 h \(or overnight).
Add 100 μl nuclease-free water to the reaction and
Extract once with 200 μl phenol/chloroform and a second time with 200 μl chloroform.
The supernatant from Step 11 is further purified with RNeasy MinElute kit \(QIAGEN) to
Move excess linkers by following the manufacturer’s protocol.
Elute linker-ligated RNA with 20 μl nuclease-free water.

Prepare the reaction in a PCR tube:
  RNA sample from previous step   20 μl
Incubate the reaction for 5 min at 65 °C, then chill on ice for ≥ 1 min.
Sequence of Mme_RTN6: 5’-GCG GCT GAA GAC GGC CTA TCC GAC NNN NNN-3’
Incubate the reaction at 25 °C for 5 min, 50 °C for 1 h, 70 °C 15 min. Hold at 10 °C.
Add 1 μl RNase H \(2 Units, Invitrogen) to the reaction and
Move RNA strand from RNA:DNA hybrid.
Purify the samples following manufacturer’s protocol.
Add at least 7-fold of the binding buffer to efficiently re
Evaluate the efficiency of linker ligation.

Prepare the following in a PCR tube:
  Purified cDNA from step 15   0.25 μl
Phusion high fidelity DNA polymerase \(NEB)   0.2 μl
Perform the thermal cycling below: 98 °C for 30 sec; 30 cycles of 98 °C for 10 sec, 67 °C for 10 sec and 72 °C for 90 sec; 72 °C for

10 min.
  Sequences of PCR primers: Mme_F: 5’-CTC AAG CTT CTA ACG ATG TAC GCT CGA-3’; Mme_R: 5’-GCG GCT GAA GAC GGC CTA TCC-3’; Fly_GAPDH1_R: 5’-GGG CCG AGA TGA TGA CCT TCT T-3’

QC is passed if positive control \(Mme_F + fly_GAPDH1_R) shows specific band, experimental control \(Mme_F + Mme_R) shows strong smear and single primer amplification \(Mme_F only or Mme_R only) shows no or weak smear.
Amplification of cDNA by low-cycle PCR

Prepare the following in a UV treated PCR tube:
  cDNA from step 19    16 μl
Perform the thermal cycling: 98 °C for 30 sec; 5 cycles of 98 °C for 10 sec, 67 °C for 10 se and 72 °C for 90 sec; 72 °C for 10 min.
If starting with less amount of RNA, more cycles can be added \(up to 15 cycles).
Add 5 μl Exonuclease I \(Exo I) to the 50 μl PCR reaction.
Incubate at 37 °C for 45 min, 80 °C for 20 min, and
Purify the samples with ZYMO Clean & Concentrator-5 kit.
To avoid airborne DNA contamination, use fresh binding buffer and
Wash buffer of the ZYMO kit.

Combine the following in a UV treated PCR tube:
  Purified PCR product from step 21   10 μl
Reaction volume at this point   27.6 μl
Incubate the reaction at 37 °C for 30 min, then 95 °C for 2 min to
Add the following two components in PCR hood to avoid potential contamination:
Perform thermal cycling as following: 5 cycles \(30 sec at 95 °C, 2 min at 68 °C, 1 min at 55 °C, 5 min at 60 °C); 5 cycles \(30 sec at 95 °C, 2 min at 65 °C, 1 min at 55 °C, 5 min at 60 °C).
Sequence of TSS_Col3_short: 5’-GCC GTC TTC AGC CGC CTCA AGC TTC TAA CGA TGT ACG-3’
Critical step: Any circular DNA contamination in this step will be amplified in the following RCA step and should be avoided2.
Use Ampligase buffer, 100mM ATP and 100mM DTT which were aliquoted and kept at -20°C.
UV treats tubes and nuclease-free water to
Add 3 μl Exo I \(NEB) and 0.6 μl Exo III \(NEB) to the 30 μl circularization reaction.
Incubate 45 min at 37 °C, 20 min at 80 °C, and
This step eliminates DNA fragments in linear form, and only single-stranded circular DNA remain after the digestion.
Directly use the reaction for rolling circle amplification \(RCA).

Combine the following in four UV treated PCR tubes:
  Circular DNA from previous step   2 μl
Phi29 high fidelity DNA polymerase \(NEB)   1 μl
Heat the reaction at 80 °C for 2 min and snap
Cool down on ice for 2 min to
Reduce bias of random primer binding.
Prepare four reactions for each sample.
Mix the reactions by pipetting and
Incubate them as following: 10 °C for 10 min, 28 °C for 16 h, 65 °C for 10 min, and
Combine the four tubes of same sample after RCA.
Determine whether the circular DNAs are specifically amplified using a built-in XhoI site in the 5’ adaptor.
This step also can help to estimate the distribution of the circular molecules.

Prepare the following reaction:
  RCA product   2 μl
Incubate the reaction at 37 °C for 1 h. Take 10 μl reaction to
Results passed QC: Majority of the RCA products were digested by XhoI and
Generate smear ranging from 200 bp to 1000 bp and peaked at ~400 bp.
Combine 4 tubes of RCA products together.
Bring a total volume of 200 μl.
Extract once with phenol/chloroform then with chloroform followed by ethanol precipitation.
Qualify the RCA products by Nano
The typical yield is around 60 μg.
Generation of ditag by MmeI digestion

Prepare the following reaction in a 1.7 ml tube:
  RCA product from previous step   16 μg
Dilute to 500 μM using 1x NEB buffer 4   20 μl
The original concentration of SAM is 32 mM. Use 1x buffer 4 \(NEB) to
Incubate the reaction at 37 °C for 30 min. MmeI digestion enables the release of small fragment \(<sub>94bp) which containing ditag3.
Concentrate the reaction to 12 μl with two DNA
Load 6 μl of purified DNA to one lane \(one sample has two lanes) in 6% acrylamide gel.
We use 18 x 16 cm acylamide gel to
Obtain better separation of MmeI digested product \(</sub>94 bp) from background.
Run the vertical gel at 200 V for 1.5 h. Compare the intensity of bands with the DNA standard \(100 bp band of Invitrogen’s 10 bp DNA ladder), we estimate that the desired DNA fragment is ~7.2 pmol.
Purification of MmeI digested small fragment
Use a new Razor Blade \(VWR) to
Cut the desired band \(~94 bp) which contains both TSS
Elute each gel slice with 400 μl gel elution buffer \(0.1% SDS, 0.2 NaCl, 10 mM MgOAc2).
Rotate at least 6 h at room temperature or overnight at 4 °C.
Phenol/chloroform extraction followed by ethanol precipitation.
Suspend the sample in 20 μl nuclease-free water.

Combine the following in a PCR tube:
  Purified DNA from previous step   20 μl
Mix the reaction for at least 20 times to
Ensure the even distribution of PEG8000.
‘p’ denotes phosphate group; ‘N’ represents any nucleotide.
Concentrate with ZYMO Clean & Concentrator-5 kit.
Elute the ligation product with 10 μl nuclease-free water.

Prepare the following in a PCR tube:
  Linker ligated DNA from previous step   10 μl

Incubate for 30 sec at 98 °C, followed by a 2 cycles of \(10 sec and 98 °C, 10 sec at 66 °C, 30 sec at 72°C) and 10 cycles of \(10 sec and 98 °C, 10 sec at 69 °C, 30 sec at 72°C), additional extension for 10 min at 72 °C and then
Take 3 μl of PCR product to
See a specific band of 213 bp.
If very strong non-specific amplification occurs,
Perform size selection \(~180 bp) after linker ligation.
A library with good quality should have a relatively strong band \(~213 bp) compared to the primer dimers.
Size selection in an acrylamide gel
Purify the remaining 47 μl PCR product and
Load the purified sample to an 8% acrylamide gel and
Stain the acrylamide gel with EtBr for 2 min and
Cut the ~213 bp band under UV transilluminator.
Elute the gel slice with 400 μl gel elution buffer \(0.1% SDS, 0.3M NaOAc, pH5.2) and
Rotate at room temperature for at least 6 h or at 4 °C overnight.
Purify the final library with ZYMO DNA
Load multiple times for mixture more than 700 μl.
Quantify the final library by Qubit fluoromerter according to manufacturer’s protocol.

The concentration of our sample \(fly 0-24h embryo) is 1.3 ng/μl.
  TIP:
This size selection step is to
Increase the quality of paired-end library.
Evaluate the quality of the final TSS library.
Use 5 μl out of 30 μl final library for the QC by Sanger sequencing.
We obtained 20 qualified clones; 18 of the clones could be mapped to annotated Drosophila TSSs \(± 250nt).
The final library passed QC was subjected to paired-end sequencing by Illumina Genome Analyzer IIx.
